verses.verse: For all this I laid<WH5414> to my heart<WH3820>, even to explore<WH952> all this<WH6662>: that the righteous, and the wise<WH2450>, and their works<WH5652>, are in the hand<WH3027> of God<WH430>; whether it be love<WH160> or<WH1571> hatred<WH8135>, man<WH120> knoweth<WH3045> it not<WH6440>; all is before them.

All things come alike to all<WH259>: there is one event<WH4745> to the righteous<WH6662> and to the wicked<WH7563>; to the good<WH2896> and to the clean<WH2889> and to the unclean<WH2931>; to him that sacrificeth<WH2076> and to him that<WH834> sacrificeth<WH2076> not<WH2896>; as is the good, so is the sinner<WH2398>; and he that sweareth<WH7650>, as he that feareth<WH3373> an oath<WH7621>.

This is an evil<WH7451> in all that is done<WH6213> under the sun<WH8121>, that there is one<WH259> event<WH4745> unto all<WH3820>: yea also, the heart of the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120> is full<WH4390> of evil<WH7451>, and madness<WH1947> is in their heart<WH3824> while they live<WH2416>, and after<WH310> that they go to the dead<WH4191>.
For <WH4310> to him that is<WH3426> joined<WH2266> with all the living<WH2416> there is hope<WH986>; for a living<WH2416> dog<WH3611> is better<WH2896> than a dead<WH4191> lion<WH738>.

For the living<WH2416> know<WH3045> that they shall die<WH4191>: but the dead<WH4191> know<WH3045> not anything<WH3972>, neither have they any more a reward<WH7939>; for the memory<WH2143> of them is forgotten<WH7911>.

As well their love<WH160>, as their hatred<WH8135> and their envy<WH7068>, is perished<WH6> long ago<WH3528>; neither have they any more a portion<WH2506> for ever<WH5769> in anything that is done<WH6213> under the sun<WH8121>.

Go thy way<WH3212>, eat<WH398> thy bread<WH3899> with joy<WH8057>, and drink<WH8354> thy wine<WH3196> with a merry<WH2896> heart<WH3820>; for God<WH430> hath already<WH3528> accepted<WH7521> thy works<WH4639>.
Let thy garments<WH899> be always<WH6256> white<WH3836>; and let not thy head<WH7218> lack<WH2637> oil<WH8081>.

Live <WH2416> joyfully<WH7200> with the wife<WH802> whom thou lovest<WH157> all the days<WH3117> of thy life<WH2416> of vanity<WH1892>, which he hath given<WH5414> thee under the sun<WH8121>, all thy days<WH3117> of vanity<WH1892>: for that is thy portion<WH2506> in life<WH2416>, and in thy labor<WH5999> wherein thou laborest<WH6001> under the sun<WH8121>.

Whatsoever thy hand<WH3027> findeth<WH4672> to do<WH6213>, do<WH6213> it with thy might<WH3581>; for there is no work<WH4639>, nor device<WH2808>, nor knowledge<WH1847>, nor wisdom<WH2451>, in Sheol<WH7585>, whither thou goest<WH1980>.

I returned<WH7725>, and saw<WH7200> under the sun<WH8121>, that the race<WH4793> is not to the swift<WH7031>, nor the battle<WH4421> to the strong<WH1368>, neither yet bread<WH3899> to the wise<WH2450>, nor yet riches<WH6239> to men of understanding<WH995>, nor yet favor<WH2580> to men of skill<WH3045>; but time<WH6256> and chance<WH6294> happeneth to them all<WH7136>.

For man<WH120> also knoweth<WH3045> not his time<WH6256>: as the fishes<WH1709> that are taken<WH270> in an evil<WH7451> net<WH4685>, and as the birds<WH6833> that are caught<WH270> in the snare<WH6341>, even so<WH1992> are the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120> snared<WH3369> in an evil<WH7451> time<WH6256>, when it falleth<WH5307> suddenly upon them<WH6597>.
I have also seen<WH7200> wisdom<WH2451> under the sun<WH8121> on this<WH2090> wise<WH1419>, and it seemed great unto me:

There was a little<WH6996> city<WH5892>, and few<WH4592> men<WH582> within it<WH935>; and there came a great<WH1419> king<WH4428> against it<WH5437>, and besieged it<WH1129>, and built great<WH1419> bulwarks against it<WH4685>.

Now there was found<WH4672> in it a poor<WH4542> wise<WH2450> man<WH376>, and he by his wisdom<WH2451> delivered<WH4422> the city<WH5892>; yet no man<WH120> remembered<WH2142> that same poor<WH4542> man<WH376>.
Then said<WH559> I<WH2451>, Wisdom is better<WH2896> than strength<WH1369>: nevertheless the poor man<WH4542>'s wisdom<WH2451> is despised<WH959>, and his words<WH1697> are not heard<WH8085>.
The words<WH1697> of the wise<WH2450> heard<WH8085> in quiet<WH5183> are better than the cry<WH2201> of him that ruleth<WH4910> among fools<WH3684>.
Wisdom <WH2451> is better<WH2896> than weapons<WH3627> of war<WH7128>; but one<WH259> sinner<WH2398> destroyeth<WH6> much<WH7235> good<WH2896>.
